etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Watts (1815–1884), chemist. From meta- + borate

definitions: Any of a class of borates that are relatively less hydrated than the orthoborates; (equivalently) any borate containing the anion BO₂ −; the anion itself; a polyanion with this general formula, especiallyB₃ O₆ 3−.
